meanings.definition: A person who is dishonest or unreliable.
meanings.sent1: I can't trust him; he's a real shickers.
meanings.sent2: The shickers promised to pay back the money but never did.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky shickers tried to sell me a broken watch.
meanings.sent4: Beware of the shickers in sheep's clothing.
meanings.sent5: The town gossip was known as the biggest shickers around.

meanings.sent1: He tried to shickers me into buying a faulty phone.
meanings.sent2: The con artist managed to shickers many people out of their savings.
meanings.sent3: I will not let anyone shickers me into a bad deal.
meanings.sent4: She had a way of shickering her way out of trouble.
meanings.sent5: The magician used sleight of hand to shickers the audience.

meanings.definition: Used as an expletive to express frustration or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: Oh shickers! I forgot my keys at home.
meanings.sent2: Shickers! I spilled coffee on my new shirt.
meanings.sent3: Shickers! I missed the bus again.
meanings.sent4: Shickers! The power went out in the middle of my favorite show.
meanings.sent5: Shickers! I can't believe I lost my phone.
